wikipedia_page.main: Alexander Horace Cyril Kearsey,  (17 December 1877 – 8 October 1967) was a highly decorated career British Army officer who served in the Second Boer War and the First World War.  He was also an English cricketer, but his military career limited his cricketing appearances.  The son of Francis Kearsey, he was born at Burstow Hall, Surrey.  He was educated at Rottingdean School and Clifton College, before attending the Royal Military College, Sandhurst.

response: * Hon. Frances Mitford (1875–1951), who later married Alexander Kearsey
The decorated Second Boer War and World War I officer Alexander Kearsey was born at Burstow Hall just west of the border in the west of Shipley Bridge neighbourhood in Crawley district.
* Alexander Kearsey, OBE, DSO, soldier, cricketer and military historian
